intro: Cyananthus incanus, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a notable species in high-altitude ecosystems. Cyananthus incanus is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
